name: Haber-Bosch Process
description: Industrial synthesis of ammonia from nitrogen and hydrogen gases.
conditions: High pressure (200 atm), moderate temperature (400-450°C), iron catalyst
applications: Critical for global food production through fertilizer manufacturing.

name: Grignard Reaction
description: Formation of carbon-carbon bonds using organomagnesium halides.
conditions: Anhydrous ether solvent, inert atmosphere (absence of water and oxygen)
applications: Synthesis of alcohols, pharmaceutical intermediates, and complex organic molecules.

name: Diels-Alder Reaction
description: Cycloaddition between a conjugated diene and a dienophile.
conditions: Wide range of conditions; often room temperature, can be accelerated with Lewis acids
applications: Synthesis of cyclic compounds, natural products, and pharmaceuticals.

name: Wittig Reaction
description: Converts aldehydes or ketones into alkenes using phosphonium ylides.
conditions: Strong base, typically at room temperature
applications: Synthesis of alkenes with precise double bond positioning, vitamin A synthesis.

name: Friedel-Crafts Acylation
description: Electrophilic aromatic substitution reaction introducing acyl groups.
conditions: Lewis acid catalyst (typically AlCl₃), anhydrous conditions
applications: Production of aromatic ketones, pharmaceuticals, dyes, and fragrances.
